Description.val:
The FY 2021 funding request was reduced by $46.204 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

The FY21 budget request supports continued installation, engineering support and programmatic support for USS Cowpens (CG 63), USS Gettysburg (CG 64), USS Chosin (CG 65), USS Hue City (CG 66), USS Anzio (CG 68), USS Vicksburg (CG 69), USS Lake Erie (CG 70), and USS Cape St George (CG 71).

Modernized Ticonderoga Class cruisers are multi-mission, large surface combatants which will operate as the Air Defense Commander platform for Carrier Strike Groups, as units of Surface Action Groups, in support of Marine Amphibious Task Forces, or independently in multi-threat environments that include air, surface and subsurface threats.  These ships respond to Low Intensity Conflict, Coastal and Littoral Offshore Warfare, and joint mission scenarios as well as open ocean conflict, providing and augmenting power projection and forward presence.  These ships conduct Air, Surface and Undersea Dominance, Land Attack, and Force Protection missions.   The Ticonderoga Class is currently executing the CG Modernization (Mod) Program which upgrades combat systems; command, control, communications, computers, and intelligence (C4I) systems; and hull, mechanical, and electrical (HM&E) systems to achieve an extended service life and pace the multi-mission threats.

[P40A / CC013- INSTALLATION /DSA / AIT]: Provides Planning Yard Design Services Allocation (DSA) (design, advance planning, and kitted material), MSR installations and AIT installation support (ILS).

[P40A / CC014 - CONJUNCTIVE COMBAT SYSTEM ALTERATIONS]: Conjunctive Combat System Alterations includes design integration, equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support.

[P40A / CC015- MULTI-MISSION SIGPRO]: Procures Multi-Mission Signal Processor (MMSP) including equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for Ticonderoga Class Ships.

[P40A / CC016- SPY-1B VARIANCE TRANSMITTER UPGRADES]: Provides upgrades to the existing Radio Frequency Monitor (RFM), existing Driver/Pre-Driver (DPD) and modifies existing Deckhouse Wave Guide for Ticonderoga Class Ships.

[P3A / CC001 - SPQ-9B UPGRADE]: Procures SPQ-9B for all CG Modernization ships including equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics.

[P3A - 2 / CC003 - COOPERATIVE ENGAGEMENT CAPABILITIES (CEC)]: Procures Cooperative Engagement Capability (CEC) that includes equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) for anti-air capabilities on Ticonderoga Class Ships.

[P3A - 3 / CC004 - AN/SQQ-89 A(V) 15 PROCUREMENT]: Procures AN/SQQ-89 A(V) 15 with Multi-Function Towed Array (MFTA) combat systems to replace the installed MIL-STD AN/SQQ-89(V) for Baseline 3 and 4 Ticonderoga Class ships including equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P3A - 4 / CC007 - AEGIS WEAPONS SYSTEM (AWS) UPGRADE PROCUREMENT]: Procures AEGIS Weapons System (AWS) upgrade for Ticonderoga Class Ships including equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P3A - 5 / CC008 - VERTICAL LAUNCH SYSTEM (VLS)]: Procures Vertical Launch System (VLS) Modifications, Evolved Sea Sparrow Missile VLS Modifications, SM3 Operability Heating Ventilation Air Conditioning (HVAC) and VLS MODS for SM3 Block 3 combat systems for Ticonderoga Class Ships including equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P3A - 6 / CC010 - MK34 UPGRADE]: Procures MK34 Gun Weapon System (GWS) upgrade for Ticonderoga Class Ships including equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

[P3A - 7 / CC011 - INTEGRATED SHIP CONTROLS (ISC)]: Procures Smartship Integrated Ship Controls (ISC) for all ships requiring upgrade including equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS).

Justification.val: The significant decrease from FY20 to FY21 is due to inclusion of only ONE HM&E availability award in FY21 versus TWO CG Mod combined Combat System and HM&E availability awards in FY20.

Name.@footnote: (1) The Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2015, H.R. 8110 re-appropriated and extended the Ship Modernization Operations and Sustainment Fund (SMOSF) to provide for costs associated with the continued operations and modernization of eleven cruisers. (2) FY15 and FY16 funding was provided via SMOSF transfer for procurements and installation for CG 63 Cowpens, CG 64 Gettysburg, CG 65 Chosin, and CG 69 Vicksburg. (3) SMOSF was rescinded in FY17 and placed in the Navy budget.

FY 15 combat system for the USS Cowpens (CG 63), USS Gettysburg (CG 64). FY16 procurement for USS Chosin (CG 65) and USS Vicksburg (CG 69) were funded by SMOSF.  Installation funding for a ship is divided over a three-year period. Installation execution funding in the year of availability, and Design Service Allocation (DSA) two years prior to availability, and DSA in the year prior to the availability.  This includes ship checks, ship installation drawing (SID) development, logistic document development and long lead time material procurements (LLTM). Installation costs across the FYDP may vary depending on current port rates. Port rates are updated every year by a CNRMC letter based on the forecasted port loading model. Port loading rate forecasts are the rates recommended for all budgeted maintenance and organic modernization within a specific port. Individual ship's availability durations vary dependent upon the integration of ship's maintenance and modernization work packages.
